import React, { useState } from 'react'; const RoofConfigurationForm = ({ roofConfig, onConfigChange, projectedArea, actualRoofArea, visible = true }) => { const [showAngleTooltip, setShowAngleTooltip] = useState(false); if (!visible) return null; // Generate roof angle options from 0 to 90 in increments of 10 const roofAngleOptions = Array.from({ length: 10 }, (_, i) => i * 10); // Determine which area to display const displayArea = actualRoofArea || projectedArea; return (

Current Roof Details

{/* Roof Size Display - Simplified */} {projectedArea > 0 && (
Roof Size: {displayArea.toFixed(2)} m²
)}
{/* Roof Angle Tooltip */} {showAngleTooltip && (
setShowAngleTooltip(false)}>
e.stopPropagation()}>
Roof Angle Impact

How roof angle affects your roof area calculation:

  • Flat roof (0°): Roof area equals the measured projected area
  • Angled roofs: Actual roof area is larger than projected area
  • Formula: Actual Roof Area = Projected Area ÷ cos(angle)

Examples:

30°: ×1.15
45°: ×1.41

A steeper roof provides more actual surface area for solar panels than what appears from above.

)}
); }; export default RoofConfigurationForm;
